sourceMeaningMnemonic: Something made of <radical>gold</radical> <radical>stand</radical>s in a <radical>village</radical>. It's a <kanji>bell</kanji>!  The village bell.
meaningInfo: Every village has a bell of its own, standing tall and proud and shiny in the middle for everyone to see and hear.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>bell</kanji> rings whenever the <reading>Shou</reading>gun (<ja>しょう</ja>) arrives in the village. Its ringing echoes throughout the entire village so everyone knows they have to come out and pay their respects.
readingInfo: The Shougun bell even sounds like it's warning you that the Shougun has arrived. It makes a loud, low shooooouu shooou sound.
